intro: Rafnia rostrata subsp. pluriflora, commonly known as the many-flowered Rafnia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories.
